title: Bookjacket, "Bookjacket for "Medieval Panorama" by G.G. Coulton, Meridian Books", 1955
medium: Lithography in red, black and white ink on white shiny wove paper
signed: Signed in printed black ink, front cover lower left: lustig.
inscribed:
Printed in black ink, front cover upper left: M/P;  center: The English scene from Conquest to Reformation; lower margin: MERIDIAN BOOKS published by the Noonday Press/MG 2  $1.95. Printed in white ink, front cover upper half: edieval/anorama; left center: by G.G. COULTON.
Printed vertically in black ink, spine: M P G. G. COULTON; printed horizontally in black ink, spine lower margin within white square: MG 2. Printed vertically in white, spine: edieval anorama MERIDIAN BOOKS.
Printed in white ink, back cover upper left center: edieval/anorama. Printed in black ink, back cover: M/P/The English Scene from Conquest to Reformation/by G.G. COULTON/In this monumental survey of the English social scene/from 1066 to the middle of the 16th century, G.G. Coulton/presents all aspects of medieval life, from religion, litera-/ture, and the arts, to sports, law, farming, crafts, and/trade.  With a literary skill that is rare in one who is so/noted for his scholarship, G.G. Coulton brings to life this/colorful period which was of such importance for the/formation of England as a nation. Like the original edi-/tion, this Meridian Giant is profusely illustrated with/contemporary woodcuts, and it includes both notes and/index./All Meridian Books are Smyth-Sewn for Durability.
creditline: Gift of Tamar Cohen and Dave Slatoff
description: Design for book cover featuring from left to right: back, spine, front cover. Entire cover is red with black and white text. The M and P in the title are in an Old English text style. On the back cover of the book is the title, author and synopsis of the book.
